intro: Sphaerosacme laxa, commonly known as the slender sac scale, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to conserve water. Sphaerosacme laxa is often found in rocky soils and is well-suited for xerophytic gardens.
